description: An example EBD file is Windows.ebd , which is used to store indexing information for Windows searches in Windows 8 and Windows Server 2012. Another example EBD file is systemsf.ebd , which is a system file located in the C:\​Windows\​System32\​ directory.
NOTE: EBD also stands for Emergency Boot Disk. However, files that use the *.ebd file extension are not necessarily related to emergency boot procedures.
